page.title: 12Principal features Rowston.
page.content: There is a Norman Church with an Early English tower and a crocketed spire. The existing manor house was built in 1740. This is believed to be the third manor. One is thought to have been situated in the grass paddock in front of the existing Manor, and the other being in the farmyard. The Manor until recently was the centre od the Bloodstock company of the Dennis family and therefore is surrounded by grass paddocks and stables. In 1973 the stables round the house were taken down along with a small windmill. The house was modernized. In 1984 further modifications took place. Although the Manor was built in the Georgian period it is without doubt of Queen Anne design and style. At present it is a Grade 2 listed building. There is also an ancient village cross.
